alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 8:07AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Moffat, northeastern Uintah and southeastern Daggett Counties through 830 AM MDT... At 807 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles northeast of Vernal to 35 miles east of Whiterocks to 15 miles northwest of Dinosaur. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Moffat, northeastern Uintah and southeastern Daggett Counties, including the following locations... Greystone. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Utah between mile markers 164 and 165. U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 368 and 371. Colorado 318 between mile markers 2 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains
